page.title: 01LIBANUS VILLAGE
page.content: LIBANUS USED TO BE TWO HAMLETS ; THE NORTHERLY ONE WAS CALLED TAI'R BULL AND THE SOUTHERN WAS LIBANUS BUT BEING SO CLOSE TOGETHER, ABOUT HALF A MILE DISTANT, THEY WERE TURNED INTO ONE VILLAGE CALLED LIBANUS. LIBANUS IS THE ONLY VILLAGE IN WALES THAT TAKES IT'S NAME FROM IT'S CHAPEL WITH OTHER PLACES IT'S THE OPPOSITE WAY AROUND. THE POPULATION OF THE VILLAGE HAS GROWN SINCE 1984 WHEN THE COUNCIL BUILT NEW HOUSES, PEOPLE ARE RENOVATING SOME OLD ONES, THEY ARE ALSO LAYING NEW FOUNDATIONS FOR THIRTY SIX MORE HOUSES. THE AREA AROUND LIBANUS IS CALLED THE BRECON BEACONS AND IS LOOKED AFTER BY THE NATIONAL PARKS.THE TWO MAIN OCCUPATIONS IN THIS AREA ARE FARMING AND TOURISM. THE AMENITIES OF THE VILLAGE ARE THE PRIMARY SHCOOL THE CHURCH, THE CHAPEL THE POST OFFICE, AND THERE ARE BUSES.
